title: Mud Bricks Changed Everything
description: One-minute skill: Mud Bricks Changed Everything.

hook.text: The oldest cities on Earth were built from dirt mixed with straw. Literally mud pies scaled up.

buildup.text: Around 7500 BC in Mesopotamia, people discovered that sun-dried mud held its shape and stacked well.

discovery.text: Mud bricks were uniform, cheap, and insulated against desert heatâ€”perfect building blocks for cities.

twist.text: Later, firing bricks in kilns made them waterproof. This single upgrade let Babylon build the Ishtar Gate.

climax.text: From simple mud to glazed ceramic, brick technology drove 5,000 years of urban expansion.
